articles.author: Victoria Seabrook, climate reporter, and Adam Parker, OSINT editor
articles.title: Satellite images show dramatic lack of snow in ski resorts as heat in Europe 'annihilates' records - Sky News
articles.content:
Striking satellite images have revealed dirty brown hillsides around what should be pristine, white snow-covered ski resorts as record-breaking January heat hits all over Europe.
Sparse snowfall and… [+2666 chars]

articles.author: Francesca Street, CNN
articles.title: European ski resorts close due to lack of snow - CNN
articles.description: Warmer temperatures and heavy rain have stripped many European ski resorts of snow, prompting half of France's 7,500 ski slopes to close and raising concerns over long-term prospects for the continent's winter sports season.
articles.content: Top photo taken on December 30, 2022 of a ski slope in Riezlern, Austria. Photo by JFK/EXPA/AFP via Getty ImagesCNN's Joseph Ataman and Marguerite Lacroix contributed to this story.

articles.title: "Had Many Offers From Europe": Cristiano Ronaldo Reveals Reason Behind Joining Al-Nassr In Saudi Ara.. - NDTV Sports
articles.description: Cristiano Ronaldo has claimed that he had a plethora of offers from European clubs but decided to join Saudi Arabia's Al-Nassr anyway.
articles.content: One of the greatest footballers of all time, Cristiano Ronaldo, landed in uncharted territory as he joined Saudi Arabian club Al Nassr in 'jackpot deal'. His move to the Middle East as a professional… [+1694 chars]

articles.title: Buyers from Gauteng, Europe snapping up trophy homes in Cape Town - News24
articles.description: About 80% of trophy home sales in Cape Town were along the Atlantic Seaboard, especially in Camps Bay, Clifton, Bantry Bay, Fresnaye and at the Waterfront.
articles.content:
Buyers from Gauteng and Europe are snapping up trophy homes in Cape Town, according to Ross Levin, licensee at Seeff Atlantic Seaboard and City Bowl.

articles.title: Ronaldo's switch to Al Nassr highlights Portugal star's fall - Sharjah24
articles.description: Sharjah24 - AFP: Cristiano Ronaldo's steep fall has been unveiled by his move to Saudi Arabia's Al Nassr, which heralds the end of his reign as one of football's most feared attackers. Ronaldo is no longer coveted by Europe's top teams.
